abstract.p: Dell Computer establishes subsidiary in India, hoping to capitalize on nation's explosive growth in information technology (S)

block.p: Betting that India's explosive growth in information technology will translate into sales, the Dell Computer Corporation established a subsidiary in Bangalore to begin direct sales and support operations. Chip Saunders, president of Dell's Asia Pacific group, said the company would start with a $2.5 million investment and expand quickly over the next several years. ''By 2008 the Indian I.T. market is expected to be worth $50 billion. We want to be part of it,'' Mr. Saunders said.
